Qs.text: Do you have any relatives aged 50 to 70 who have been invited for breast screening?
info:
All women between 50 and their 71st birthday are invited for NHS breast screening every 3 years.

Find more information about NHS breast screening from gov.uk.

You can also encourage your relatives to check their breasts and be aware of the symptoms of breast cancer. Find out more about the symptoms of breast cancer from the NHS website.

All women between 50 and their 71st birthday are invited for NHS breast screening every 3 years.

If your relative has not been invited but think they should have been they can contact their local breast screening unit. Find local NHS breast screening units.

Find more information about NHS breast screening from gov.uk.

Download the NHS breast screening leaflet in Bengali (PDF).

Qs.text: Did your relative go for screening when they were invited?
info:
It’s great that your relative has gone for breast screening!

You can also encourage them to check their breasts and be aware of the symptoms of breast cancer between screening invites.

Find out more about the symptoms of breast cancer from the NHS website.

Talking to your relative about breast screening may encourage them to go.

Breast screening can help find breast cancer early before it can be seen or felt. This makes it more treatable.

Find more information about NHS breast screening, including the risks and benefits, from gov.uk.

Download the NHS breast screening leaflet in Bengali (PDF).

If your relative wants to get screened, they can contact their local breast screening unit.

Find local NHS breast screening units.

Talking to your relative about breast screening may encourage them to go.

Breast screening can help find breast cancer early before it can be seen or felt, which makes it more treatable.

Find more information about NHS breast screening, including the risks and benefits, from gov.uk.

Download the NHS breast screening leaflet in Bengali (PDF).

If your relative wants to get screened, they can contact their local breast screening unit.

Find local NHS breast screening units.

Qs.text: Have you ever been invited for breast screening?
info:
If you are between 50 and your 71st birthday you should be invited for breast screening every 3 years.

Contact your local NHS breast screening unit if you have not been invited but think you should have been. Find local NHS breast screening units.

You should also check your breasts and be aware of the symptoms of breast cancer.

Find out more about the symptoms of breast cancer from the NHS website.

If you are between 50 and your 71st birthday you should be invited for breast screening every 3 years.

Contact your local NHS breast screening unit if you have not been invited but think you should have been. Find local NHS breast screening units.

You should also check your breasts and be aware of the symptoms of breast cancer.

Find out more about the symptoms of breast cancer from the NHS website.

Qs.text: Did you go for screening when you were invited?
info:
It’s great that you have gone for breast screening!

Between screening invites you should also check your breasts and be aware of the symptoms of breast cancer.

Find out more about the symptoms of breast cancer from the NHS website.

Breast screening can help find breast cancer early before it can be seen or felt. This makes it more treatable.

Find more information about NHS breast screening, including the risks and benefits,from gov.uk.

Download the NHS breast screening leaflet in Bengali (PDF).

If you want to get screened, contact your local breast screening unit.

Find local NHS breast screening units.

Find out more about what happens during breast screening from the NHS website.

Download the NHS breast screening leaflet in Bengali (PDF).

You can also find more information about NHS breast screening, including the risks and benefits, from gov.uk.
